Statements from the Wisconsin Democratic: S. Sen. Tammy Baldwin calling on Donald Trump to release his tax returns, stating that every other major party nominee has done so in the past 40 years.
Citations of editorials from the New Yor: the Washington Post, and the Boston Globe, all asserting that Trump would be the first major party candidate since 1976 not to release his tax returns.
Verification from the Tax Analysts archi: which shows that all but one major-party nominee since 1976 released at least one return. The exception was Republican Gerald Ford, who only released summary tax data.
Expert opinion from Joe Thorndike: the Tax History Project director at Tax Analysts, confirming that Ford's summaries were not the same as tax returns and did not provide detailed information on income sources and charitable contributions.
